content.content: Hey all, long time lurker here. I have a question about the stable coin vaults with a maximum utilization ratio of 0 (namely USDC-A and TUSD-A): Why don’t you increase the stability fee to 10% (or even 50%) to give vault owners an incentive to pay back their debt? I don’t see any reason why they shouldn’t keep their debt indefinitely…
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is asking for feedback on the stability fee of the USDC-A and TUSD-A stable coin vaults. The post suggests increasing the stability fee to incentivize vault owners to pay back their debt. The post also invites constructive criticism on the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: Hey @Zitte and congrats on unlurk  USDC-A and TUSD-A run with a LR of 101%. If we would increase the SF it would just lead to vault owners abandoning their vaults. PSM is the favourable way forward, we already have it for USDC and it will come for other stablecoin types as well
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Thanks for the explanation. That makes more sense in combination with the LR. So a low SF would give them an incentive to switch to the better system, right?  Regarding T-USD: I still wonder why you would want 30M of (potential) bad debt on the balance sheet w/o any compensation (does it diversify your USDC holdings?). It might be minor of a problem at 1% of Dai supply, though.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: Zitte:  I still wonder why you would want 30M of (potential) bad debt on the balance sheet w/o any compensation (does it diversify your USDC holdings?).   well, in case of TUSD: we don’t want any TUSD as collateral at all. That’s why we have the Debt Ceiling set to 0. Even if you think of TUSD as bad collateral and therefor the DAI minted by it as bad debt - the best way of dealing with this bad debt is just to wait until it unwinds naturally. This i what is happening right now
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Thanks for the link. That is interesting indeed! Sorry in case I sounded rude! I just hate looking at those infinity signs on daistats all the time and wonder how you could speed up the process.
